result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J Gaulin Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Violate ATCP Dept. Regulations, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 100.26(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each count concur and concur to 15cm238.
10-20-16: Entire sentence is stayed pending appeal.
4/3/17: Court orders stay of probation lifted. Def shall receive probation credit from 11/16/15 though 10/20/16 as probation time served.
3-6-18: Probation is extended for 1 year from 4-29-18 to 4-29-19, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: Ct signed order. $610. 50 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Any tax returns to be intercepted and applied to resititution. Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$253 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JC, PW or CG. Not be in direct solicitation of auto repairs but may work for an auto repair shop.
File state and federal tax returns timely each year with copy to agent within 10 days of filing. Any tax returns to be intercepted and applied to restitution. Comply with all ATCP regulations.

records.addlTxt: Probation is extended for 1year from 4-29-18 to 4-29-19, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.  Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.

Defendant in court with Attorney Vicki Zick.  Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/ P/P agent Maria Guerrero. Hearing set at the request from the agent because defn has not paid restitution. DOC request an extension. Defn due to discharge on April  29, 2018. Statement made by P/P agent. Argument by ADA Humphrey. State request either 60 days DCJ or an extension of probation. Argument by Atty Zick. Defn request to be discharged in April. Defn exam by CT regarding tax returns. Statement by Defn. CT makes findings and requires DOC to update the CT if defn has stopped making payments towards restitution. CT makes findings that defn has not made good faith efforts towards restitution and orders probation extended for one more year. Current termination now April 29, 2019 or terminated once defn has paid all restitution. CT signs 101 form f/w.
